definition: to assume/to adopt (a look, pose, manner etc)/to bring out for display
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Dessert silverware, if not brought out with the dessert, are placed at the top of your entrée plate.
sentences.chinese: 如果甜品沒擺出來，裝甜品的銀器就放在主菜盤。

sentences.english: I know all this sounds really bad and exaggerated when it's all laid out like this.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，把這些擺出來說明，聽起來相當嚴重和誇張。

sentences.english: Siamese dancers strike a pose in a temple courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 暹羅舞者在一座寺廟的庭院前擺出姿勢以供拍攝。

sentences.english: If a man wants to sell his turnips, he needs to set them out.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人想賣蕪菁，最好把它們擺出來。

sentences.english: The people lay out their mooncakes as an offering to her during Midautumn Festival.
sentences.chinese: 每逢中秋，世人都會擺出月餅，供奉嫦娥。
她在相機前擺出做作的姿勢。

sentences.english: After being confronted with our evidence, the other side had to back down.
sentences.chinese: 面對我們擺出來的證據，對方只得作出讓步。
他擺出他那副紳士派頭。

sentences.english: Ade never fetches out his best dishes even when guests arrive.
sentences.chinese: 即便來了客人，艾德也不把他最好的盤碟擺出來。

sentences.english: At this time, he may find stubble to lose his temper or show a ill-favored color.
sentences.chinese: 這時他也許找茬發一通脾氣或擺出一副難看的臉色。

sentences.english: Therefore, the best course of action is to present them.
sentences.chinese: 因此，最好的辦法就是把事實擺出來。

sentences.english: She has laid out her husband's two-piece suit.
sentences.chinese: 她已經把丈夫的兩件頭西服擺出來了。

sentences.english: Here we lay out the best ideas that our net brought in.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，我們擺出了我們的網絡帶來的最好點子。

sentences.english: The imposing man posed as a man of good disposition and disposed of the rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 使人難忘的人擺出好脾氣的姿勢然後處理垃圾。

sentences.english: But I do believe that this question now needs to be put.
sentences.chinese: 但我確實認爲需要把問題擺出來。

sentences.english: The judge show a serious face when speaking to the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 法官對犯人說話時擺出一副嚴肅的面孔。
